title: Should you spend half-term with friends or family?
text:
If you have children or grandchildren, you’re probably thinking about half-term.

When it comes to wellbeing, where you spend your time is considerably less important than who you spend your time with. Studies repeatedly show that individuals with a strong and positive social network are not only happier and more self-confident, but also healthier and likely to live longer. So one of the best things we can do for the junior members of our family is to help them develop and strengthen their social ties.
